docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. Human Rights Council must set up a commission of inquiry into Myanmar's human rights record, as it has done for North Korea and Eritrea, and not spare its leader because of her iconic status, a former U.S. human rights envoy said on Monday.

docs.snippet: The economic stimulus bill could also be a springboard for action on some of President Obama’s clean energy and technology goals....
docs.lead_paragraph: To rally support for his administration's economic recovery bill recently, President Obama invited about a dozen chief executives, seven of them from technology and energy companies, to the Oval Office. Some of their industries' top lobbyists, meanwhile, gathered in another office where Jason Furman, a top White House economic adviser, delivered a private briefing for groups expected to benefit most from the stimulus bill.

headline.main: Stimulus Bill Bears Imprint of Technology

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
